intro: Tripleurospermum inodorum, commonly known as the common hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and linear, grass-like leaves. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in sunny, well-drained soils. The plant is often found in meadows, roadsides, and disturbed areas. It produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind, aiding in its spread across various habitats.
